New Records: Alex Hales scored 53 runs in his first international match after three years
Harry Brook scored 42 runs and contributed significantly to England's victory
Luke Wood was the player of the match with three key wickets
Key Match Events: England won the match by six wickets
Alex Hales and Harry Brook formed crucial partnerships after the loss of Ben Duckett
Harry Brook hit a boundary off Usman Qadir and performed well against Naseem Shah
Pakistan struggled against spinners and failed to chase down the target
Pre-Game Insights: England's preparation included the return of key players like Alex Hales
Pakistan faced challenges in converting their early score into a win despite home crowd support
Post-Match Reflections: England dominated the match and showed their strength
Pakistan's middle-order issues and reliance on early scoring were highlighted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first T20I between Pakistan and England since 2005
England led the series 1-0 after the match
